meanings.definition: UTIS (noun): plural of UTI, an infection in any part of the urinary system
meanings.sent1: After her doctor's visit, she learned that her frequent bathroom trips were due to utis.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed antibiotics to treat the utis she was experiencing.
meanings.sent3: The utis in her bladder decided to throw a party, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent4: The utis in her kidneys were like unwelcome guests overstaying their welcome.
meanings.sent5: The pain from the utis felt like tiny firecrackers going off inside her.

meanings.definition: UTIS (verb): third person singular present of UTI, to have an infection in the urinary system
meanings.sent1: He often utis due to his poor hygiene habits.
meanings.sent2: She utis frequently, leading to multiple doctor visits.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria utis in his bladder were having a dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The infection utis in her system like an unwelcome guest.
meanings.sent5: The pain from the infection utis in her urinary system was unbearable.
